Inclusion criteria for burn center transfer

string-array.name: medicines_list
string-array.item: " { 'title':'Nipride gtt', 'dose':'Dose: 0.3- 10 mcg/kg/min infusion', 'info':'Also known as Nitroprusside, used to reduce pressure, aortic dissection etc. dose > 4mcg/kg/min can cause cyanide toxicity within 3hrs - if a dose of 10mcg/kg/min is required for > 10min, STOP and switch to alternate agent' } "
" { 'title':'Epinephrine gtt', 'dose':'Dose: 0.1 - 0.5 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'Titrated to effect,Multiple uses include treatment for bradycardia, anaphylaxis, hypotension, ACLS' } "
" { 'title':'Dobutamine', 'dose':'Dose: start 1-20 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'Max is estimated at 20mcg/kg/min, but may cause hypotension. Used to improve cardiac contractility' } "
" { 'title':'Diltiazem gtt', 'dose':'Dose: bolus 10-20 mg then 5-15 mg/hr gtt', 'info':'Better as a rate control drug but may be used for hypertension' } "
" { 'title':'Nitroglycerin gtt', 'dose':'Dose: start 10mcg/min. Up to 200 mcg/min max', 'info':'titrate to effect, hold for hypotension, has rarely been associated with methemoglobinemia' } "
" { 'title':'Lidocaine', 'dose':'Dose: Load: 0.7-1.4mg/kg then dose 1-4 mg/min infusion', 'info':'max over 24 hours 30-50 mcg/kg/min' } "
" { 'title':'Esmolol gtt', 'dose':'Dose: 50-300 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'Primarily cardiac rate control but with some antihypertensive effects.' } "
" { 'title':'Cardene drip', 'dose':'Dose: 2.5- 20 mg/ min', 'info':'antihypertensive medication, great for neuro injury etc.' } "

" { 'title':'Kcentra/PCC', 'dose':'Only used for life threatening bleeds', 'info':'INR 2-4: 25IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 2500IU INR 4-6: 35IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 3500IU INR > 6: 50IU/kg of factor IX to a max of 5000IU - do not repeat dose - round dose up to next 500IU' } "

" { 'title':'Precedex', 'dose':'Dose: 0.4-1.4 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'central acting sleep inducer to Stage 1 sleep, no respiratory effects. Load: 1mcg/kg over 10min (not needed when transitioning from another sedative)' } "
" { 'title':'Tranexamic acid', 'dose':'Dose: 1 gram over 10 minutes in 100cc NS', 'info':'then for infusion 1 gram IV in 100cc NS to run over 8 hours at 17.2 cc/hr.' } "
" { 'title':'Phenylephrine drip', 'dose':'Dose: 0.5-6 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'used as a pressor agent' } "

" { 'title':'Dopamine drip', 'dose':'Dose: 2-50 mcg/kg/min', 'info':'historically common pressor agent, may ??? have some renal perfusion effects???? at low doses, expect some tachycardia with use' } "
" { 'title':'Propofol', 'dose':'Dose: 5 - 80 mcg/kg/hr', 'info':'sedative with respiratory depressive effects, watch for hypertriglyceridemia after 3 days of use.' } "
" { 'title':'Ativan drip', 'dose':'Dose: range of 1-8mg / hr', 'info':'MAX of 8mg/hr to prevent propylene glycol toxicity' } "

" { 'title':'Ketamine', 'dose':'RSI dose Adult: 1-2mg/kg IV RSI Peds: 0.5 - 2mg/kg IV', 'info':'Adult:
IM dose for sedation 2-4 mg/kg Procedure dosing IV: 1-2 mg / kg Followed by .25-.5 mg/kg q5-10 min as needed For Infusion: 5-20 mcg/kg/min infusion for sedation.
Peds: Procedure: .5 -2mg/kg IV May repeat .25-1mg/kg q 15 min Intranasal 5 mg/kg MAD For Infusion: 10-15mcg/kg/min \u0020\\u0020\ Ketamine is a potent sedative, amnestic, analgesic and anaesthetic agent. It has relatively little effect on the respiratory center at the doses used.' } "

" { 'title':'Glucagon', 'dose':'Beta Blocker OD: 1-3 units IV ( adult dose)', 'info':'Indicated for Hypoglycemia and Beta Blocker Overdose
Side effects: Hypotension, N/V, Hypokalemia, Rebound Hypoglycemia \u0020\\u0020\ Peds Dose: .025 units/kg IV/IM/SQ May repeat up to total of 2 doses.' } "
